1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
to toil, i.e. work severely and with irksomeness
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
to be alert, i.e. sleepless; hence to be on the lookout (whether for good or ill)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

2.brief: evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
an earthen vessel; usually (painful) toil; also a pang (whether of body or mind)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

3.brief: properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
payment of contract; concretely, salary, fare, maintenance; by implication, compensation, benefit
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

4.brief: properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
(only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people)

5.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
an opening, i.e. door or gate
